newsitem.title: GEORGIA: SOCCER-GEORGIA SAVE FACE WITH 2-0 WIN OVER MOLDOVA.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-GEORGIA SAVE FACE WITH 2-0 WIN OVER MOLDOVA.

text.p: Georgia saved face in the battle to avoid last place in their World Cup qualifying group with a comfortable 2-0 home win over Moldova on Saturday.

Two foreign-based Georgians, Shota Arveladze and Georgy Kinkladze, scored once in each half to give the home team their first points in European group two, lifting them ahead of their former Soviet ally.
Trabzonspor striker Arveladze opened the scoring in the 27th minute with a crisply struck shot to the upper left corner from just outside of the penalty box.
Manchester City's Kinkladze coolly sealed the victory six minutes after the interval from the penalty spot.
The result leaves Moldova with no points from five games. Italy and England are already assured of taking the first two places.

Georgia: 1-Irakli Zoidze; 3-Kakha Tskhadadze, 4-Levan Kobiashvili, 2-Nugzar Lobdzhanidze, 5-Georgy Chikhradze; 6-Kakha Gogichaishvili, 7-Georgy Nemsadze, 8-Gocha Dzhamarauli, 9-Temur Ketsbaia (Zaza Dzhanashia, 80); 10-Georgy Kinkladze, 11-Shota Arveladze

Moldova: 1-Denis Romanenko; 3-Vasile Tolokonnikov, 4-Ion Testemitan, 2-Oleg Fistican, 5-Vitaly Kulibaba; 7-Serghei Epureanu, 8-Oleg Shishkin (Marian Spinu, 29), 6-Alexander Popovici, 10-Alexander Sukharev; 9-Yuri Miterev (Sergei Rogachev, 29), 11-Serghei Kleshchenko.
